the most epic game ever

[h1] Шепард непростой ! [/h1]

[b] Первый адд-он к знаменитой Half - Life, где мы, в роли солдата Шепарда, отправляемся вновь в Чёрную Мезу что бы отыскать Гордона Фримена и убить его. [/b]

[i] В этом адд-оне проработан и изменен геймплей. Добавлено больше врагов которые на мой взгляд получились намного сильнее чем в оригинальной игре, да и вообще сама по себе эта часть хардкорная как не странно бы звучало. Добавлены и новые оружия - холодные оружия, (Но с ломом не сравнится ни что) с которыми на много интереснее играть чем в оригинал. Теперь за место фонарика у вас будет ночное видение, с которым в некоторых местах удобнее играть, а в некоторых местах и нет. Ну и самая вкусняшка заключается в том, что с вами, в нескольких моментах будут бегать и помогать ваши соратники. Неплохой подход к геймплею. В этом Gearbox Software отлично постарались. 

Сюжетная линия тоже завораживает, но вот правда диалоги получились тупые. Постоянно слышишь нытье солдат, которые каждый раз повторяют: "Нужно сваливать с этого места", "Забудьте о Фримене! У нас тяжёлые потери! Мы отступаем!". Это немного меня настораживает. Ведь они солдаты, нытье оставлять должны при себе. [/i]

[i] Дополнение получилось хорошим, чем то и лучше оригинала, но не более того. Пройти стоит если вы проходили первую часть, ну а если же и нет, то тоже стоит. И начните именно с этого дополнения, а после чего беритесь за оригинал. [/i]

[u] [b] [i] 8 молчаний из 10. [/i] [/b] [/u]

Less puzzles and more action, made back when Gearbox Software did not suck.
Story is farily good with a somewhat moot ending.
Enemies seem tougher, but not through AI or Tactics. Just stat shifting, taking way too much damage on the hard difficulties while one shoting you.
Lots of little hints towards what happened with freeman but nothing substancial.
Good play, if you have the time.

Zde hrajete za vojáka.Styl je pořád sejný.Taky můžete hrát trénink kde se vycvičíte v pořádnýho vojáka LOL :oD.Ve hře sem našel spoustu nových zbraní.Zbrań se mi líbyla teleportační,že buď to máte na výběr střílet po nepřátel nebo se teleportujete někam pryč kde můžete najít nějaky věci.Přibylo tu pár nepřátel a nějaká ta obluda.Konečný boss je dobře udělaný a originální.
Alien Simulator 1999. No seriously play this instead of Half Life. It's alot more fun. Tons of new weapons, fascinating creatures and great level design!
SMG grenades are your best friend! SMG grenades are your only friend!

Not as long as everyone says, but totally more Half Life, and Half Life was fantastic. Hard mode this time; some of the enemies get a little bullet-spongy near the end, which is kind of annoying, but it definitely makes the game more difficult. I gripe about the length, but it's not too short either, comparable to any modern shooter, and it doesn't outstay it's welcome. It's quite varied in tone throughout, so it never gets boring. You could say it replaces the scripted sequences of a modern shooter with masterful tone and brilliant variance in level design. Also, the GoldSource engine holds up surprisingly well today at the highest settings; it doesn't look fantastic, but if you can stomach it for five minutes you tend to forget about it. Also also if you want my advice: break every crate for ammo and health, and play the tutorial because it's funny. Yep, good game, try it if you want.

The game follows the storyline of the original Half-Life game but goes even deeper showing the final hours before the destruction of the facility that weren't in the original game. The game follows a marine who is sent to a classified mission in Black Mesa. 

The story is the same as the original Half-Life but from a different perspective. Some events that happened in the original game can also be seen in this game adding to the experience if you've played the original game. Later, the player encounters completely new types of enemies. 

The game has the same feel as the original Half-Life with all the puzzles and boss fights. Overall the game is very fun to play and is a great FPS experience.
I love  Half-Life: Opposing Force
This game was intereting as you been playing so long for gordan and now your against him. It's not often you get to play a game in your enemys shoes.
Ein sehr schönes Spiel mit einigen Rätseln und einigen neuen Gegnern und Waffen.
This game was so much better than expected despite being a half life fan in the first place it still exceeded my expectations.
Overall a really fun game, nice story. Sad we probably won't ever see Shepard again.
Not bad, not bad. I consider this to be the better of the two Half-Life expansions.

Half Life Opposing Force is an extension to the original half life game that actually has a pretty full story. It's definitely better, in my opinion, than Blue Shift.

There are the standard wide array of weapons, enemies, along with the rather dated graphics and sound [as is to be expected], so if you're a fan of the original half life then this is definitely worth playing.

Using a controller does not seem to work with this game, but it is an fps, so that's not a major issue.

И так, я поиграл в эту игру 42 минуты.. И для меня были некоторые загадки. Но в этом сюжете сразу показывается что военные не любят Фримена, и они сражаются с монстрами. До этого я еще  не дошел. Но что на счет (Графики) ГРАФИКА КОНЕЧНО ЖЕ СТАРАЯ НО ЭТО НЕ ВОЛНУЕТ. ИГРЫ ЛЮБЯТ НЕ ЗА ГРАФИКУ А ЗА СЮЖЕТ ТАЙНЫ, И ВСЯКОЕ ТАКОЕ ВООБЩЕМ ИГРУШКА НЕПЛОХАЯ

[b]If you already played Half-Life and are wanting more, here's why this is a great pickup:[/b]
[list]
[*] First expansion after the original Half-Life, playing as a Marine
[*] The story progresses further and some of the original story is filled with more details
[*] New weapons were added, including some Black Mesa prototypes
[*] A "Grappling hook", a rechargeable shock gun, a teleport gun and a live rocket launcher!
[*] Smart, cohesive story that ties heavily to the original Half-Life
[*] New enemies that bring out new gameplay and difficulties
[*] Still feels like Half-Life in its entirety with puzzles and gameplay being very similar
[*] Marines are now your teammates, including a medic!
[*] You can take more than two NPC's with you now!
[/list]

[b]Still, a great game cannot come with it's flaws:[/b]
[list]
[*] The weapon selection menu extends up to number 7, which is too far for easy selection
[*] Most of the times, you'll be using a weapon in number 5 and 7, which sucks double-time
[*] Some levels feel very unbalanced, where you lose all your ammo or grind out to finish
[*] Spec Ops appear alot at the end and nobody likes invisible, fast moving targets.
[*] Ammo for some weapons is so limited you fear using them in the wrong enemies.
[/list]

In the end, this is a expansion of story on Half-Life, with the same feel as the original. If you enjoyed the original Half-Life, then you will feel right at home with this expansion, while soaking in some new story related details that populate what happened to Black Mesa after Gordon Freeman left to Xen, while also tying masterfully into the timescale of what happens in the original game before Gordon Freeman goes to Xen. You should definitely play this.

[b]If mine (And any other) review was helpful and informative, please mark it as helpful.
We should have good reviews in the store page, not jokes. Thank you![/b]

Great Expansion with new alien enemy types and new wepaons. Explores events during and slightly after the story of Half-Life 1.

very good game that expands appon different aspects of the resonance cascade. You play as Adrian Shepard a marine sent to cover up the Black Mesa incident but you never get the exterminate order so you are on the side of the scientists. You are confronted with new enemies from Race X the dimension on the other side of Xen. They may be intellegent but that doesnt mean they arent hostile. I'll let you play the game for your self but trust me its one heck of a ride!

Essentially the same as the first game but this time you can sometimes ask the worst-trained marines on the planet to help be body-shields for you. Seemed like this one has more emphasise on combat than story-line and does introduce a few new enemies while revisiting familiar locations. You may even see a familiar mute with glasses running around for a bit. *nudge nudge hint hint* I didn't enjoy very much that health and ammon drops were fairly rare which made things a bit more tedious than expected.

If you liked the first one and wanted a short expansion on the universe (took me 6 hours), this is an excellent choice.
7/10

Not as good as Half-Life, not that this means anything. This game is essentially a shorter version of Half-Life but with different weapons. Some segments are very similar like you encounter a worm-like creature that you have to kill, not by direct fire, but by flushing it after turning on the power and such (like the Blastpit chapter from Half-Life). I think that if you're interested in Half-Life, which most people are, then this expansion is a really good deal. If you are one of the few people that haven't played Half-Life and want to try out a cheaper expansion that costs less, don't even bother because you will enjoy Half-Life and this game and therefore you're better off buying the Half-Life 1 Anthology.

以下涉及严重剧透









HL1最成功的资料片，丰富有诚意的剧情，而且在原作武器的基础上增加了更多有创意的的武器。

游戏与原作时间线基本平行，角色变成了接受政府指令前来黑山基地灭口掩人耳目，并除掉弗里曼的HECU陆战队，但是直到深入黑山基地之后，主角发现外星生物比弗里曼更加难对付，部队不得不撤退。但是当主角要前往撤退直升机的时候，神秘人GMAN毫不留情的关上了停机坪入口的门，把主角一人困在这里，经过一番探险主角发现有一个神秘而训练精良的黑衣人部队也参与了此次事件，并且和GMAN有神秘的联系，而且外星生物和陆战队是他们共同的攻击目标，为了逃出这里，主角不得不继续硬着头皮走下去，直到消灭了基因蠕虫，神秘人Gman正式与主角在一个扭曲的空间面对面交谈，将主角囚禁起来（类似于HL1将弗里曼冷冻长眠），并且使用核弹将黑山夷为平地..

虽然是非官方撰写剧本，且某些地方与原作略有矛盾，不过他很好的诠释了前作中没有解开的谜团，神作当之无愧

Half-Life Opposing Force is an expansion pack to Half-Life. You play as one of the marines that participates in the Black Mesa Incident (See Half-Life). Although the gameplay is not to different from Half-Life here are some of the things I liked and disliked.
Pros:
-A more detailed and immersive story (imo)
-New types of enemies (Instead of reusing old enemies, although classics like headcrabs are present)
-More different character models
-New weapons with a mix of old weapons
-Nice concept of commanding your own squad
-Same fun gameplay as Half-Life
-Less platforming sections

Cons:
-Squad AI can be wierd some times (Like if you want an enginner to follow you through a door he will sometimes move to the door, and then walk away from you repeatedly)
-Not enough medical / H.E.V supplies like the original Half-Life to help you out a bit
-Underused mechanics like rope swing
-No Half-Life 3

Overall, Half-Life Opposing Force is very entertaining if you loved the original Half-Life than you will not be disappointed. (8.5/10)
It's awesome that you could play through the eyes of your enemy. Nice story.
This game makes Call of Duty seem like Disneyworld

Opposing Force is the first expansion pack for the five star new standard bearer FPS Half Life 1. The bottom line is this is a great expansion pack.

You are a marine, Corporal Adrian Shepard sent into the Black Mesa facility after Half Life 1's protagonist Gordon Freeman uh accidentally created a rift in space / time and brought aliens in. Everyone talks to you in the game without cut scenes.

When you start the game, Gordon in Half Life 1 is still there and your mission goes from being sent to kill him to fighting for your own survival. You visit portions of the first game yet changed, such as you will visit some of the entry tunnel from the first segment of Half Life 1. You will visit the dam from the original game. Everything changed with new challenges in each. There are plenty of puzzles some are different than the original game and others are more complex. Such as instead of having to use a push box once, you need to use it 3x pushing it from room to room.

I'd say those old environments (destroyed with new challenges) are maybe 1/100th of the map content. The new environments feel fresh and they use a lot of lighting to make it look different. It feels fresh because the other universe is starting to be integrated into our own universe through the aliens making it and because Black Mesa had creature exhibits. There are new textures, you'll go through vine covered sewers where giant fat aliens have their nests.

There are also new gameplay elements that you will be introduced to in an optional training course. The training course is a very nice tutorial that will show you everything new such as ropes to climb and swing on. It's a very nice mechanic. The flashlight has been replaced by night vision goggles which are very nice. You also have new squad mates to find in the game that will aide you like the medic who can heal you on command, the engineer who will blow torch his way through some doors and your standard commandos. Each of these three will fight intelligently and won't just stand around getting shot. They will defend the territory if you command them to stand there.

That's another thing the enemy and friendly AI is great as always from the game. AI will run from grenades, throw their own grenades, flank you, run from your fire and other things. It's very nice.

There are a lot of new weapons. I was surprised. You start with new melee weapons, a new pistol with an optional laser sight, a new sniper rifle that can be quite useful, new alien technology (if you don't want to hear just skip to the next paragraph), such as an electrical gun, a cannon that looks like a BFG from Doom (only more awesome), an acid spitting alien, and a ceiling grabber (yes the enemy) that can be used as a hook shot!

All the old enemies are here too... but there are a lot of new enemies too (if you don't want it spoiled, skip on!), the new enemies seem to be faster and more dangerous. From waist high creatures that run to you, to taller electric shooting aliens controlled by ant like parasites, giant fat electrical discharging enemies... and their offspring, the list goes on, but you'll be surprised at some of the things the expansion comes up with.

With a 5+ hour play through the first time, I do wish it was a bit longer so they could divvy out the enemies a bit slower. But hey it's an expansion pack. The graphics are not improved and they still have bugs like getting stuck in the floor of elevators and lifts, but all of that can be overlooked. A lot has been added to make this expansion worth anyone's time. Great expansion pack!

I played the original Half Life long long ago. This game is great! I played Blue Shift and was disappointed so I got this one afterwards. This has so much more gameplay, harder monsters, more monsters, way more weapons, alien weapons not in HL. This game is much better than Blue Shift. 
If you download the MAC version, I believe it has a glitch on the final boss as it did for me.

Интересное и достаточно сложное дополнение, в которое именно нужно поиграть после прохождения Half-Life и Half-Life: Blue Shift. Вы взгляните на всю эту историю с совершенно другой стороны, и узнаете много итересных нюансов.

Edited Review:

Half-Life Opposing Force, you play as the guys that were supposed to do the clean up, though in this case is different as you are sent out without any damned clue, assuming your mission is to RESCUE the scientists, not to kill them, so on your way out you keep helping the people that are on your way... as it wasn't enough though, you get new enemies as well, X race and Black OPS. 

Black OPS supposedly being commander under Gman's hand, considering at the time Gman was a important character, either CIA or something else, they take orders from him specifically.

And Race X, oh damn pretty cool guys I tell ya, Race X are different from Xenians, as they don't use any sort of technology, at best they are more organic than Xenians, as for what they were their goal? same as Xenians I assume.... take over the world, screw up them combines maybe...but anyways, we never really seen Xenians and Race X fighting each other though, so I wonder if that would have happened eventually? maybe?

Going back to the game, it adds some new tools as well, a knife, wrench, a displacer, that... barnicle stuck on your arm? the shooting green goo and spider that shocks you, no wonder why Race X has aliens named "Shock Troopers".... because... heh... .they stun you....

As for the story, it's a nice addition to see other sectors of the complex, as it gives you a new idea of how big the complex compound actually is and what else they do, in general, Black Mesa is everything you want... for all I know, Black Mesa could been a vault to store survivors from a disaster as well.... but hey, how ironic... the disaster happened INSIDE the complex, since y'know... it's a Research Facility and.... no venture no gain as they say.

More fun than Half-Life (better weapons, enemies not seen in Half-Life, also wrench > crowbar), but if when I kill the final boss, I could actually reach the final scene and not be trapped in the boss chamber due to a glitch, that'd be great.

Compared to Half-Life, the gameplay is both more chalenging with the new enemies introduced and more interesting with the new weapons, but the shorter story mode leaves much to be desired. Overall, I'd recomend this to anyone that likes older fps games or fans of the Half-Life series in general.
It's aite.

Bardzo dobry dodatek. Nie odstaje zbytnio od podstawki. Możemy zobaczyć wydarzenia w Black Mesie z innego punktu widzenia. Są nowe bronie, które zastępują nam te z Half-Life. Jednakże nie różnią się działaniem, a wyglądem, np. rewolwer został zmieniony na pistolet, a kusza na snajperkę. Wyglądają inaczej, ale strzelają bardzo podobnie. Są też jednak takie bronie, których wcześniej nie było, np. harpun-Barnacle, nóż i kilka kosmicznych ustrojstw. Oprócz tego zamiast latarki mamy noktowizor i są liny, po których można się wspinać. Opposing Force jest krótszy od podstawki, ale gra się w niego z taką samą przyjemnością jak w Half-Life. Polecam każdemu, komu spodobała się podstawowa gra.

A good DLC, not too short, not too long, and even new weapons and new monsters.

This was almost as engrossing as Half-Life actually was. Of course, you can't beat God (Half-Life, in this case) if you're an angel (OF), God is God for a reason! And that's the stupidest analogy I've ever made up, but bear with me, games like Opposing Force are never easy to make justice in words. But what I mean is, even though this game can't beat Half-Life, it was incredible. I'm not going to lie; I found certain things a tiny, tiny tiny tiny bit more "WOOOAAHHH" than Half-Life, but y'know... HALF-LIFE, MAN.

Something that amazed me from the game is the fact I was actually busting my ass to save every grunt I encountered. I loathed these bastards in Half-Life and Blue Shift; I mean, they killed the poor scientists/security guards and actually enjoyed it! It was so sad! And I'm so used to killing them that every time I encountered a group of HECU marines, I'd panic and start shooting them. Then I'd be like "Oh. Right", and pressed the F9 key (my reload last save). At first I didn't mind and let them die, but dammit, they grew on me, to the point I'd truly be attempting to save them. I just felt fond of them. Except for the grunt that pushes the scientist when he's asking for Freeman when you're about to board the Osprey in which you're supposed to escape. That grunt I killed. ALSO, TWO GRUNTS ABANDONED ME IN CHAPTER 11 (The Package). I WENT TO EXPLORE A ROOM AND WHEN I GOT OUT THEY JUST DISAPPEARED. Cunts.

Getting more serious now, something that really impressed me from Opposing Force besides the guns, the Race X and the new "puzzles", was the large-scale battles you can have at times. If you take care of your squad, you can have a group of at least four grunts with you. So when you encounter a lot of enemies, the fights are phenomenal! Sadly, this only happened once to me, I was barely able to get three grunts to follow me most of the time because some grunts were just too stubborn and stupid to follow me. This is the strongest flaw I encountered in the game; the grunts' AI is really stupid in the vast majority of the time. And they were also generally pretty useless in battle, and I'm not even counting the times I died because of friendly fire. However, there was one time in which I was able to have an epic Black Ops-Shock Troopers-HECU battle. Replayed it about four times just to repeat the breathtaking sequence. Unfortunately, it was hard to achieve and generally I spent too much time in the game trying to get everyone to follow me, which is simply precious game-time wasted. This is quite disappointing, in my opinion, since the rest of the game is of such extreme quality. 

Being someone who's mostly played modern games, I have to say Opposing Force (as well as HL and BS) looks really good and its graphics are not bad at all for being a nearly twenty year old game. And even if the graphics were terrible (they're decent, in my opinion), the game would make up for it with its fantastic atmosphere, gameplay, battles, bosses, guns, ambiance and so forth. I also adored Gordon's direct and indirect appearances; his "employee of the month" photograph (was that his office?), his constant mention by the grunts and finally his Chapter 6 ("We Are Not Alone") direct appearance: where you actually see him. I seriously replayed that sequence seven times. I LOVE WHEN GAMES CONNECT WITH EACH OTHER SO DIRECTLY. Thinking that while you're still fighting your way through Black Mesa, Gordon is beating the crap out of Gonarch and everyone (or everything?) else. Opposing Force is, quite simply, a passionate application of creative design. I seriously cannot wait for Tripmine Studios' remake. 

Definitely recommend the game. But as I also said on my BS review; only play it if you have played Half-Life. Otherwise, the game might feel dull to you and you won't understand the storyline, and won't be able to fan-girl over Gordon's appearances/mentions... well... if you're a crazy fan. Like me.

More than just "Half-Life with new levels".
It's "Half-Life with new guns, new enemies, a small unit management system, new puzzles, and basically a whole lot of new stuff".

Множество новых противников, оружия разной степени оригинальности от ручных зверушек (аж три!) до BFG 9000, и пара-тройка геймплейных новшеств по сравнению с оригинальной Half-Life. Попытка симпатизировать морпехам HECU и объяснить присутствие Black Ops, с добавлением их мужских версий. Результат весьма странный и неканонiчный, хотя интересный и достойный.

"Как ты, наверное, заметил, у твоей снайперской винтовки есть СНАЙПЕРСКИЙ ПРИЦЕЛ!"
i like the game but it wont even start up it just goes black but yah i heard the games really cool.
Прошел на одном дыхании за 5 часов... Как 15 лет назад. Классика.

Opposing Force streitet sich auf meiner Half Life Favoritenliste ständig mit HL2E2. Einfach nur ein geiler Zusatz, mit logischer und nachvollziehbarer Handlung und die neuen Waffen sind einfach nur geil.

Ich fange jetzt nicht mit dem Zusammenfassen der Story an, aber man ist Corporal Adrian Shepard, soll mit seinem Team Gordon Freeman ausschalten (warum auch immer), man gerät aber direkt in den Black Mesa Zwischenfall rein und muss sich dann mit großer Mühe und vor allem Geduld, da manchmal die Gegner einfach sau unfair sind, z.B. 10 Voltigores auf einmal) wieder entkommen. Am Ende kommt dann ein für Half Life typischer G-Man Monolog, und man erfährt wieder nicht, was mit der Hauptfigur passiert.

Das Spiel macht für sein Alter alles richtig, bis auf die komische Funktion des Seilkletterns oder die Balance zwischen Schaden nehmen und Heilen. Mit den manchmal vielen Gegnern kommt man klar, wenn man sich mit dem Spiel zurecht gefunden hat. Die vielen Neuerungen gegenüber zum ersten Half Life, wie neue Waffen, das Seilklettern, odder tatsächlich ein erstes mehr oder weniger funktionierendes Teamsystem, machen echt Spaß und bringen etwas Abwechslung rein. Das Tutorial funktioniert auch prächtig. Man lernt alles, was man braucht, von Springen und Klettern, verschiedene Schusswaffen bis hin zum Kennenlernen seines Platoons, ist alles dabei. Am Besten am Tutorial gefällt mir, dass der Sergant am Anfang aus dem Film "Full Metal Jacket" zitiert.

Mit dem Spiel bin ich als geübter Half Life Spieler gut klar gekommen, auch wenn ich manchmal wegen den dummen Black Ops fast einen Anfall bekam. Aber ich hab mich zusammengerissen und denen die Fresse mit dem Elektrokäfer (meine Lieblingswaffe in OF) eingeschossen. Leider war das Spiel recht schnell vorbei, und ab dem Punkt, wo man alleine im Lagerkeller gegen die Black Ops kämpfen muss (ihr werdet es meken, welche Stelle ich meine), fühlte sich das Spiel irgentwie dahingerusht an, als ob es genervt wäre und alles schnell hinter sich haben wollte. Auf eine Fortsetzung warte ich bestimmt nicht als Einziger, aber vermutlich vergeblich. Der Multiplayer ist auch ok, aber nicht das Highlight, da oft viele Leute auf einmal einen hohen Ping bekommen.

Zusammenfassung: Mal die andere Sichtweise von Half Life 1, macht aber viel Spaß und ist das bisschen Geld absolut wert. Coole Waffen, coole Kämpfe, cooles Spiel. Wenn ihr Half Life 1 gemocht habt, kann ich euch das Spiel nur empfehlen, allerdings ist es kein Einstiegstitel in die Serie, da würde ich euch lieber HL2 vorschlagen.
Great expansion for the first Half-Life.

laggy 
 i try to play this game  but sometimes it lags more than my newer games

Release in 1999 Half Life Opposinf Force was the first expansion to the ever popular Half life game. 
Really awesome game whit an awesome storymode that tells the player the story of Adrian Shephard and his journey inside Black mesa.

I consider this to be among the one of the best expansions released during the time Half-Life was at its peak of popularity. It still remains an amazing experience to play to this day. The main game and even the training camp/tutorial make for an amazing experience for players who have enjoyed playing the original Half-Life (and for nostalgic purposes).

Sadly the lore it added to the Half-Life universe was never carried over to future games in the franchise. Perhaps for the best as I myself felt the content it added never could fit in or relate with everything else Half-Life had to offer. Also not much content (maps and mods) was produced for it compared to Half-Life.

First-person-shooter mission packs are usually mediocre: Throw together a few new levels, put in some more guns, add a spider, and you've got a commercial add-on for your aging product. As such, it's appropriate that Gearbox Software's Opposing Force, the official expansion for the genre-redefining Half-Life, in turn sets a new standard of quality for future action-game mission packs.

Opposing Force's story recounts the events of Half-Life, but from the opposing side's perspective as implied by the title. You are Marine Corporal Adrian Shephard. You've been sent to the Black Mesa Research Facility to locate and eliminate Gordon Freeman. As in the original, things immediately go awry, mistakes are made, people die, and your initial plan is replaced with a complicated fight for survival. It's a testament to the success of Half-Life that its story actually warrants retelling. The developers know that while Adrian Shephard has no idea what Freeman is doing, you do, and they pack the game with clues as to where you are in relation to Half-Life's hero. Your path initially converges with Freeman's, then takes some unexpected detours. Many of the original settings and incidents are referred to or revisited from a slightly altered perspective, and it's a ringing endorsement of their effectiveness that to give any of them away would lessen your enjoyment of the game.

Like Half-Life, Opposing Force's greatest strength is its success at consistently delivering surprises. You can sense the designers' enthusiasm as one memorable scene unfolds after another, and it compels you to keep playing. Although Opposing Force is only about one third as long as its predecessor, it's packed with original content. There isn't much filler in the game, so while you may finish it in just over ten hours or so, the experience feels much more complete and satisfying than many longer games, which tend to be padded with hours of drearily similar firefights.

Despite its relatively short length, there's plenty of shooting in Opposing Force. Instead of limiting you to fighting alongside no more than two of Half-Life's weakling scientists or security guards, you can now recruit a squad of up to eight marines. The marines have the same advanced artificial intelligence as when they were your enemies in Half-Life, so that some of the large-scale battles staged in Opposing Force are simply phenomenal. Even though the game doesn't require you to do so, you'll want to replay such combat sequences just to try out different strategies in an effort to reduce friendly casualties.However, although the game lets you lead so many companions, you'll likely never have more than four at a time thanks to the AI's finicky following behavior. Opposing Force's only significant flaw is that it's often difficult to keep your followers in line. In some instances they simply appear to become confused, and at other times there is an invisible line they will not cross. It's usually unclear which of these two reasons keeps your squad from moving forward, so you'll spend too much time trying in vain to keep it assembled. This is a shame, as the rest of the game is of such high quality.





Opposing Force adds nine new weapons to Half-Life's arsenal. There are a few additions to each original category - standard guns, experimental guns, and alien artifacts - and each is useful for the most part. An especially clever version of a grappling hook is put to good use in many of Opposing Force's action sequences and puzzles. The new experimental weapon's secondary firing mode transports you to a small section of the alien world Xen, where you can gather some extra health and ammo in the heat of battle.

Most of the aliens in Half-Life weren't nearly as crafty as the enemy soldiers. Opposing Force introduces a new breed of alien warrior that is the marine's tactical equal, along with about ten other new allies and adversaries, including a few impressive boss monsters. Some of the new 3D models are merely window dressing but add to the game's rich atmosphere. A great number of scripted sequences have also been created for Opposing Force, which are often darkly humorous - the designers at Gearbox seem to harbor a real grudge against Half-Life's hapless scientists and dispatch them with sadistic ingenuity.

Opposing Force doesn't include any new multiplayer game modes but is packaged with a set of multiplayer maps designed by a team of "all-stars" assembled by Gearbox, including such level design luminaries as Tom "Paradox" Mustaine and the Levelord. As you'd expect, these map designs are all at least competent. Most of the new weapons and character models are also available in the multiplayer game. However, the excellent single-player experience remains the best reason to get Opposing Force.

While it doesn't add anything new to the graphics or technology of Half-Life, Opposing Force still manages to thrill through the impassioned application of creative design. It's the interactive equivalent of a page-turner; you'll finish it in a marathon sitting just trying to see what surprise lies around the next corner. Quite simply, the best first-person shooter ever released is now bolstered by the finest mission pack yet created.

Uno de mis shooters favoritos de antaño, cuando conoci half life por ahi del año 2000 no me imagine la posibilidad de jugar del lado de los swat.
Usa el mismo motor del hal life original asi que tiene unas graficas bastante buenas aunque eso si muy "cuadradas" tenemos que tener en cuenta que en esos tiempos era lo mejor que se tenia en graficas y a mi parecer se sigue viendo bastante bien para ya tener minimo unos 15 años.
La jugabilidad es muy comoda, sus controles creo que ahora son un "estandar" en la industria de los juegos, la camara al ser en primera persona es igual bastante comoda y no se tiene el (horrible) problema de que haya puntos en los que pierdas de vista a tu personaje...
Este juego es muy recomendable tenerlo sobre todo si ya jugaste hal life 1 y te enganchaste con la historia.
Lo malo.
Lo que realmente encontre malo en este juego fue el final, despues de terminar el juego segun recuerdo de haberlo jugado fuera de la paltaforma de steam salia una animacion y con eso se concluia el juego, en esta version terminas con el jefe final y no pasa nada, no corre la animacion y no puedes ver el "final" como tal, se me hace increible que no exista solucion a este problema pero bueno fuera de eso todo muy bien.

Classic FPS game you can't miss out on 10/10

Very great sidestory, very good gameplay, however poor multiplayer.

Would recommend this to those that goes for story mode, and probably for mods too.

Opposing Force suffers from some irritating issues, but it's a good choice, especially for 2€.

[+] It's half life for christ's sake
[+] It's 1,5x longer than Blue Shift and has much more gameplay variety
[+] G-Man behaves in a more intrusive manner than in the original
[+] It's very challenging, makes the original HL look like a walk in the park...

[-] ...but sometimes is simply unfair - some enemies are extremely overpowered
[-] Many weapons. Yes, it's a flaw, because there is simply too many of them. While the sniper rifle and machine gun are great, you don't need two crowbar substitutes (wrench and knife) or another explosive weapon (alien origin doesn't mean it's different thus necessary). Barnacle hook is fun to play with, but useless in battle.
[-] The god fucking damn AI. Your companions are retarded and won't follow you if you step into a simple corridor.
[-] Grafical style - while I don't mind outdated graphics, the "new" models made solely for Opposing Force seem to be in a little bit inconsistent style in comparison to HL1's assets, but it's not all that noticeable.
[-] At some point in the game (about the last 1/3, shortly after obtaining barnacle hook) there is a disturbing lack of headcrabs.
[-] The ending. While not as plain as Blue Shift's, it's a little bit disappointing after the interesting boss battle that BS lacked

If you played HL1 and liked it, you definitely should check it out.
When buying on sale, BS seems like a better idea since it's 1€ instead of 2. You should, however, get both right away.
good game

∙하프라이프의 또 다른 외전격 게임 블루 쉬프트와는 달리 다양한 무장과 새로운 적을 추가한다거나, 야간 투시경이나 분대 시스템같이 본작에는 없던 시스템을 도입하는 식으로 훨씬 알차고 완성도 높은 게임을 만들려고 했다는 제작사의 노력이 느껴짐. 플레이타임도 10시간가량으로 훨씬 길다. 
∙다만 새로이 추가된 적인 X 종족을 아무런 설명도 없이 등장시켰다는 점은 아쉽다. 또한, 플래시 라이트를 대체하는 야간 투시경은 게임 내내 오랜 시간 켜고 다니게 되는데 계속 보다 보면 눈이 아프다는 점도 문제임. 플레이어를 잘 따라오지 않는 분대원도 답답하게 느껴짐. 그러나 신선한 시도를 했다는 점 하나만은 높게 평가할만함
∙유독 이 게임을 하면서 어딘가에 끼이는 버그가 많았음. 우연일지는 몰라도 꽤 신경 쓰였음.

This is a great add on to one of the best games of all time. It adds new mechanics, a new perscective, and a fresh story. It also fills us in on loads of gaps in the big picture on the Half-Life. It has the same problems as Half-Life, obviously, namely being that it is terribly old, but if you're willing to look past the superficial, you'll have some real fun. A good game, and a MUST GET for Half-Life fans.
Years later, and it's still getting reviews.

Half-Life: Opposing Force is the first expansion for the original Half-Life and was developed by Gearbox Software and published by Valve. Gearbox Software have made a thoroughly brilliant expansion for Half-Life which I could imagine, was no easy task, since it had to mirror the world of Half-Life whilst adding something new to the plate.

In Opposing Force the player gets to see the Black Mesa Incident from a different perspective. You play as one of the military specialists assigned to located and eliminate Gordon Freeman but the main objective ends up being to pull out of the alien infested and fragile Black Mesa Research Facility.

This expansion really well done and cleverly coincides simultaneously with the events of the original game. The gameplay is similar to the way the original plays but since you are playing the role of a military specialist (Adrian Shepherd is the protagonist's name), the game is tailored to meet these changes. You have a wealth of weapons and tools at your disposal with the trusty crowbar being replaced by a trustee wrench. The new weapons feel fresh and interesting to keep combat varied and fairly tactical. There is a new Desert Eagle for you to use and alien weapons such as the Barnacle tongue launcher to cling to higher places. A great deal of the weapons match what would be used by a United States Marine Corps military specialist.

The core health system has been kept the same with the player having main health and armour health. However, there are changes to this system such as using a Power Combat Vest (PCV) as opposed to normal HEV suits. Health packs, health stations and PCV stations aren't the only way to replenish health and armour. You now regularly find squad mates in the form of medics who can help you out in rough situations. The medic can be used to assist in assaults on the battlefield and you can also take advantage of them to administer first aid, ultimately refilling lost health. Another type of new NPC is the engineer which is crucial towards progressing further into the game. Like the medic you can have the engineer aid you in the game when it comes to firepower, but obviously not with first aid. The engineer is invaluable to get through heavily secured steel doors as they are equipped with the tools and expertise to accomplish this. I found these additions to be a neat touch since it gave the game a more tactical feel. And since there didn't seem to be a wealth of health stations and packs, the player is kind of forced to make use of the medic and the engineer.

The creatures of the mysterious and fascinating alien world of Xen are present in Opposing Force but there is a delightful number of new alien creatures for you to battle against. These alien creatures manifest themselves during the latter parts of the game and are known as Race X suggesting that they are separate from the world of Xen and are from a different world and dimension. The following are some of the names for the Race X creatures: Voltigore, Pit Drone, Pit Worm, and Shock Trooper.

As you would expect with an expansion pack the game is a little bit shorter than the original but still provides around 5 - 10 hours of enjoyment with solid gameplay and an interesting storyline which skilfully coincides with the first game. This is surprisingly a very good expansion and will leave you feeling satisfied.

I played this game after beating the orignal Half Life as well as Half Life 2 and all its episodes. Going in to Opposing Force, I didn't know what to expect. While I enjoyed Half Life 1, coming fresh from the updated and arguably superior format of it's sequels made me worry that the original game's engine wouldn't hold up to Source. Boy, was I wrong. Opposing Force is a fantastic expansion that, much like the original game it's adding to, holds up to the test of time and is an absolute blast throughout. I'd say I even liked it more than Half-Life 2's episodes. Definitely a must for anyone who enjoyed Half-Life 1 and is itching for more adventures in Black Mesa.
